faculty_data_fetching_structure.overview: This document describes the refactored data fetching structure for faculty pages. Data is now fetched progressively - fast initial load with minimal data, then lazy loading on user interaction.
faculty_data_fetching_structure.principle: Progressive loading: Show classes immediately (fast), then fetch section-specific data only when user clicks/selects. Use sessionStorage for instant cached display.

initial_load.description: FAST initial load - show classes immediately from sessionStorage cache if available, then fetch fresh data in background
initial_load.when: On component mount, only if facultyId exists
initial_load.caching: sessionStorage for instant display, enhanced cache for 5 minutes
initial_load.loading_behavior: Show cached data immediately (if available), fetch fresh data in background (non-blocking)

on_class_selection.description: LAZY LOAD - When a class is clicked, fetch ONLY data for that specific section. Show cached data immediately if available.
on_class_selection.trigger: User clicks on a class card

students.loading_behavior: Show cached data immediately (if available), fetch fresh data in background

attendance_sessions.when: When selectedClass changes AND attendance mode is active

attendance_records.when: When selectedClass changes AND date is selected

on_class_selection.no_prefetch: Do NOT prefetch data for other classes. Only fetch for selected class.

initial_load.description: When page loads, fetch only the list of classes assigned to the faculty
initial_load.when: On component mount, only if facultyId exists

on_class_selection.description: When a class is selected, fetch ONLY assessments for that specific section
on_class_selection.no_prefetch: Do NOT prefetch assessments for other classes. Only fetch for selected class.

on_assessment_selection.description: When an assessment is selected for grading, fetch ONLY grades for that assessment

initial_load.description: When page loads, fetch only the list of classes assigned to the faculty
initial_load.when: On component mount, only if facultyId exists

on_class_selection.description: When a class is selected, fetch ONLY data for that specific section
on_class_selection.no_prefetch: Do NOT prefetch data for other classes. Only fetch for selected class.

initial_load.description: Currently a placeholder page. Will follow same pattern when implemented.

prefetchFacultyData.description: This function previously fetched data for ALL classes. It is now removed/replaced with section-specific fetching.
prefetchFacultyData.old_behavior: Fetched classes, departments, and other data for all classes at once
prefetchFacultyData.new_behavior: No bulk prefetching. Data is fetched on-demand per section.

dual_cache_system.description: Two-tier caching: sessionStorage for instant display, enhanced cache for persistence

sessionStorage.purpose: Instant display on page load - shows cached data immediately
sessionStorage.behavior: Show immediately if available, fetch fresh data in background

enhanced_cache.cache_duration: 5 minutes for classes list, 10 minutes for section-specific data
enhanced_cache.cache_invalidation: Invalidate when data is modified (create, update, delete)

classes_list.purpose: Get list of classes assigned to faculty
classes_list.returns: Array of section courses with minimal data

section_students.purpose: Get students enrolled in a specific section
section_students.returns: Array of students with enrollment info

section_assessments.purpose: Get assessments for a specific section

assessment_grades.purpose: Get grades for a specific assessment
assessment_grades.returns: Array of student grades for that assessment

section_student_grades.purpose: Get total grades for all students in a section

attendance_sessions.purpose: Get attendance sessions for a specific section

attendance_records.purpose: Get attendance records for a specific section and date

data_flow.step_2: Show classes IMMEDIATELY from sessionStorage cache (if available) - instant display
data_flow.step_3: Fetch fresh classes list in background (non-blocking)
data_flow.step_5: Show cached section data IMMEDIATELY (if available) - instant display
data_flow.step_6: Fetch fresh section data in background (students, assessments, etc.)
data_flow.step_8: If user switches class, show cached data immediately, then fetch fresh data
data_flow.step_9: Cache all data in sessionStorage for instant next access

benefits.performance: INSTANT initial page load - show cached classes immediately, fetch fresh data in background
benefits.efficiency: Reduced database queries - only fetch needed data when user interacts
benefits.scalability: Better performance with many classes - doesn't load all data at once
benefits.user_experience: Instant display from cache, smooth interactions - no waiting for API calls
benefits.network: Reduced bandwidth - only fetch data user is viewing, use cache when possible
benefits.perceived_speed: Users see content immediately, fresh data loads seamlessly in background
